intro: Tithymalus ruscinonensis, commonly known as the Ruscinian tithymalus, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is native to the Balkan region. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a delicate, fern-like appearance. Tithymalus ruscinonensis is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
